programme.desc: UFOs and Native Americans: Native American myths steeped in the otherworldly go back thousands of years, but new evidence and modern-day UFO sightings have experts rethinking. (S2, ep 7)

programme.title: Paranormal: Caught On Camera: Top 100
programme.desc: ...Camera - Top 100. A collection of standout videos from season one, showcasing the most chilling and unexplainable paranormal activity footage captured by eyewitnesses. (S1, ep 7)

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth's Big Mistake: Les finally lands a buyer for his special edition Lee Iacocca Mustang, but loses his cool when he learns Seth sent the hot rod out on consignment. (S13, ep 11)

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Return of the Egyptian Gods: A British woman in the 20th century stunned Egyptologists by accurately locating structures and artefacts. Perhaps she had an otherworldly agenda? (S14, ep 20)

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: UFO Hotspots: Studies show 70% of UFO sightings occur in 'hotspots', where unusual phenomena is regularly reported. Is there something about these places that attracts visitors? (S15, ep 1)

programme.desc: Henry and Sam look to make a profit on motorcycle memorabilia. (S1, ep 3)

programme.desc: Bubba And The Chocolate Factory: The buyers head to the affluent town of Las Colinas, where they hope that mega mansions spell luxury lockers. (S4, ep 2)

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: I Don't Give a Dime: A seller brings in an unusual diamond crafted from the DNA of a musical genius. A vintage book collection also comes in, and Chum has a birthday surprise for Rick.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Series following colourful life in a large pawn shop. From alligators to false limbs, its staff has no idea what could come through the door next, and profits come with a huge risk.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Series following life in the Gold family's huge and colourful pawn shop, where every day they encounter great treasures, bizarre collectables, old junk and crooked sellers.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn: Behind The Deal
programme.desc: Acid Test: The Golds get real about old school vs new school. Seth wants to purchase a pricey piece of equipment that could save the store thousands. (S1, ep 2)

programme.desc: UFOs vs the Royal Airforce: The Royal Airforce has been encountering UFOs on a regular basis since World War II, but the British government has consistently denied the sightings. (S2, ep 8)

programme.title: World's Greatest Treasure Mysteries
programme.desc: The Lost Cache of Cornwallis: Matty goes blackwater river diving in search of the legendary Revolutionary War treasure of British army officer Charles Cornwallis. (S3, ep 7)

programme.title: Pawn Stars

programme.title: Ancient Aliens

programme.desc: The Bad Fish Paradigm: Penny opens up to a reluctant Sheldon after a less-than-stellar first date with Leonard, putting him in the awkward position of having to keep a secret. (S2 Ep1)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Codpiece Topology: Seeing Penny out on a date with another guy sends a distressed Leonard rushing back to Leslie Winkle, much to Sheldon's dismay. (S2 Ep2)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Barbarian Sublimation: Penny becomes addicted to an online game based on the world of Conan the Barbarian and begins to pester Sheldon for advice. (S2 Ep3)

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Proper Wedding and Skeletons in the Closet: Georgie and Mandy get married. Meemaw's gambling room gets raided. (S7 Ep7)

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: An Ankle Monitor and a Big Plastic Crap House: Sheldon studies to be Meemaw's lawyer when she's put on house arrest, and the Coopers have a plumbing emergency. (S7 Ep8)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Dance Dance Revelation: Everyone gets in on the fun at Luke and Manny's first school dance. A trip to the mall with the boys becomes stressful for Jay and Phil. (S2 Ep10)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Slow Down Your Neighbors: Claire becomes a determined neighbourhood vigilante hoping to catch and stop a menacing car that speeds through the streets. (S2 Ep11)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart After Dark: Bart gets a job at a burlesque theatre. Several residents are keen customers, but others aren't happy to have the showgirls peddling their wares in Springfield. (S8 Ep5/25)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: A Milhouse Divided: When Milhouse's parents split up, his mum gets together with an American Gladiator called Pyro, his dad self-produces an album and Milhouse goes a bit crazy. (S8 Ep6/25)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Cushion Saturation: A game of paintball leads to a squabble when Penny accidentally shoots paint at one of Sheldon's cushions. Romance blossoms between Howard and Leslie. (S2 Ep16)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Terminator Decoupling: Leonard, Sheldon, Howard and Raj discover that beautiful sci-fi actress Summer Glau is on board their train to San Francisco. (S2 Ep17)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Work Song Nanocluster: Penny's home-based business selling hair accessories gets out of hand when an overexcited Sheldon takes charge of production. (S2 Ep18)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: How I Spent My Strummer Vacation: Homer goes to a rock 'n' roll camp. When it's time to leave, he just wants to keep rockin' with Mick Jagger, Keith Richards and Lenny Kravitz. (S14 Ep2/22)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Podcast News: Grampa is accused of murdering his girlfriend aboard a cruise ship. Meanwhile, Kent Brockman decides to make a crime podcast. (S32 Ep6)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart Has Two Mommies: Marge babysits Rod and Todd, but Ned overreacts when she lets them play on a climbing wall. Bart gets pulled into a chimp cage at the zoo. (S17 Ep14/22)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer Simpson, This Is Your Wife: Homer signs the family up for a wife swap show, but easy-going husband Charlie (Ricky Gervais) develops a crush on Marge... (S17 Ep15/22)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Kiss Kiss, Bang Bangalore: Mr Burns outsources the plant to India and puts Homer in charge of training the workforce. Patty and Selma kidnap a celebrity. (S17 Ep17/22)

programme.title: Daddy's Home 2
programme.desc: (2017) Comedy sequel with Will Ferrell, Mark Wahlberg, Mel Gibson and John Lithgow. There's trouble in store for the extended family when Dusty and Brad's fathers visit for Christmas.

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Luke, who's lost his dating mojo, is raring to re-invigorate his love life and find a lady to relight his fire. And can pole dancer Abi find someone to send her heart into a spin? (S12 Ep4)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: A celebration of Naked Attraction's very best naughty bits, revisiting some bad romances, from arguments to cringeworthy moments, including Cathy and Andy's explosive reunion.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: On the box this time: Britain's Got Talent, One Night Stand, Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars, Freeze the Fear with Wim Hof and Great British History Hunters. (S19 Ep12) [SL]

programme.desc: Bear Gliding: The Lemmings kite surf with a homemade kite. Grizzy decides to make a kite that is far more sophisticated than the Lemmings' kite to win she-bear's affection. (S1 Ep37)

programme.desc: The Sound of a Lemming: Grizzy snatches the last jar of chocolate spread out from under the noses of the Lemmings. In exchange, he offers them the toy stuck inside the lid: a mini-flute. (S1 Ep38)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Bear in the Wind: The Lemmings play a new game but interrupt Grizzy watching his favourite TV show. (S1 Ep39)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Life Of Pie: When Izzy, Jude and Owen accidentally bring a pizza to life they do everything they can to help it find a new purpose in life, other than being eaten. (S2 Ep49)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Abaracaduncan: When a magic trick goes sideways, Duncan makes a great escape and Harold becomes the target of a Sorcerer Hunt! (S2 Ep50)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Shock & Aww: When Courtney gets the old, gross daycare carpet replaced with a new one, the resulting static electricity has unexpected consequences. (S2 Ep51)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: School District 9: When a career-predicting machine tells Owen he has no skills to offer the world, Owen finds a way to prove the machine wrong in the most Owen way possible. (S2 Ep52)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Gumbearable: After accidentally swallowing a piece of gum, Owen has to protect his friends by jumping into a gum volcano. (S3 Ep1)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Whack Mirror: Chef warns Beth and Cody that making goofy faces into a mirror will cause them to get stuck that way. It turns out he was right, just not in the way any of them ever imagined. (S3 Ep2)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Broken Back Kotter: Izzy nominates Chef for the Daycare Professional of the Year award and will do whatever it takes to see him win. As it turns out, it takes a lot. (S3 Ep3)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Weekend at Buddy's: After Cody's best friend doll breaks on their watch, Owen and Beth put themselves in grave danger while trying to do the right thing. (S3 Ep4)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Polar Bear: Nutty Hill is suffering from a heat wave. Searching for a bit of cool air, Grizzy has a brilliant idea. He'll get into the fridge, where the temperature will be more bearable. (S1 Ep1)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Bear Spread: Grizzy is frustrated: just as he was about to coat a nice big fresh salmon with chocolate spread and snuggle up in front of the TV, he discovers that the pantry is empty! (S1 Ep2)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Cellular Bear: Grizzy's nap is interrupted by the forest ranger's cell phone. (S1 Ep3)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Jurassic Bear: Freed by the thawing ice, a giant egg slides up to the front door of the cabin. The lemmings watch the hatching of a baby dinosaur that soon thinks they are its parents. (S1 Ep4)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Extreme Fitness: In order to woo the she-bear he's infatuated with, Grizzy decides to take things in hand and get into shape with the ranger's bodybuilding equipment. (S1 Ep5)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Domestic Robots: Grizzy discovers that the ranger's new robot vacuum cleaner also gives very pleasant back massages, but the lemmings see the new gadget more as competition... (S1 Ep6)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Mass Control: While searching for the television remote control, Grizzy discovers a gadget that controls various functions in the cabin. (S1 Ep7)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Bear Under Control: To make sure that the lemmings don't snatch his chocolate spread while he's taking his nap, Grizzy turns the fridge into a safe - combination lock and all. (S1 Ep8)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Popcorn Party: The lemmings have invented a new popcorn game. When Grizzy notices that his she-bear seems to be drawn by the smell, he invites her over for a snack, just the two of them. (S1 Ep9)

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: Piñata Party: Grizzy finds a birthday piñata in the ranger's living room. (S1 Ep70)

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: Bear Game: Grizzy and the Lemmings discover a magical Game of the Goose. The events displayed in the squares that the players land on come true in real life. (S1 Ep71)

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: Ranger Lemming: Grizzy is bothered by an object stuck in between the sofa cushions: a big fur lemming puppet glove. (S1 Ep72)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Total Trauma Rama: Duncan, normally the bad kid, has an identity crisis when his pranks start curing people of their fears. (S3 Ep49)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: The Doomed Ballooned Marooned: After over-decorating a birthday table with balloons, several kids float away to a deserted island. (S3 Ep50)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Legends of the Paul: Duncan is jealous of Paul's 100-year time out and, determined to be King of the Pranks, has to team up with Paul, learn his ways and double-cross him to become a legend. (S3 Ep51)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: A Bridgette Too Far: As season three draws to a close, Bridgette becomes desperate to star in an episode. (S3 Ep52)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Robo Teacher: When a substitute teacher fills in for Chef, Duncan thinks it's going to be the best day ever. He's wrong. (S2 Ep1)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Glove Glove Me Do: Owen's newly found gloves make him great at everything. But this greatness comes at a high price. (S2 Ep2)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: The Tooth About Zombies: Gwen's favourite event, the Zombie March, falls on the same day as Beth's nightmare event, dental check-up day. The two girls find a way to help each other out. (S2 Ep3)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Lie-ranosaurus Wrecked: Owen pretends to be Izzy's pet dinosaur after leading her to believe she dug him up in the school playground. (S2 Ep4)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Random Bear: Grizzy and the lemmings fight over chocolate-spread jar lids, which they use as chips in a competition to win goodies. (S1 Ep16)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Lemming Interference: Grizzy has prepared himself a TV dinner, but his meal is interrupted by unexplained static. Grizzy finds that the true 'interference' is down to the lemmings. (S1 Ep17)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: High Voltage Bear Attack: The lemmings are having a party, but when Grizzy throws their ghetto blaster into the river he sparks a power cut! (S1 Ep18)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Bear Scents: Grizzy decides to give she-bear the flowers that decorate the window ledges of the ranger's cabin. Can he bring them to her without the lemmings ruining them? (S1 Ep19)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Bear Luck: After making a fool of himself in front of she-bear, Grizzy finds a four-leaf clover which seems to bring him good luck. Could his chance be changing? (S1 Ep20)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Magnetic Bear: Grizzy can't believe his eyes when he sees objects moving all by themselves, but it's the lemmings who are playing around. (S1 Ep21)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Bear Charm: Grizzy believes that the she-bear he's in love with has been turned into a frog. He looks through the ranger's book of fairytales, searching for a way to turn her back. (S1 Ep22)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Bear's Best Friend: Grizzy discovers a baby raccoon near the log cabin. When the lemmings drag the baby into their dangerous games, the overprotective Grizzy steps in. (S1 Ep23)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Super Grizzy Bros: Grizzy discovers the joy of video games on the ranger's console. The lemmings want to try their hand at the joystick but Grizzy refuses to interrupt his racing game. (S1 Ep24)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Bad Seed: Chef introduces the kids to agriculture by teaching them how to grow plants from seeds. But when Izzy shows her seed too much love, it turns into a monster! (S2 Ep44)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: A Fish Called Leshawna: After eating some mystery fish sticks, Leshawna achieves every little girl's dream and transforms into a mermaid! (S2 Ep45)

programme.title: Mermicorno: Starfall
programme.desc: When You Squish upon a Star: Squishella's given the opportunity to become the pop star she's always dreamt of being, but fame comes at a cost. (S1 Ep106)

programme.title: Unicorn Academy
programme.desc: Under Starglow Lake: When grim magic contaminates the academy's water supply, the unicorns risk losing their power unless Sophia can save Starglow Lake with an unlikely ally. (S1 Ep4)

programme.title: Rainbow Butterfly Unicorn Kitty
programme.desc: Denzel In Distress: Felicity and Miguel rescue a prince named Denzel who's been imprisoned by his evil brother, Prince Larry. (S1 Ep21)

programme.title: Rainbow Butterfly Unicorn Kitty

programme.title: Unicorn Academy
programme.desc: The Vision Pool: Eager to decode the message from the Whispering Willows, Sophia skips party planning to visit the Vision Pool, after promising Ava she wouldn't. (S1 Ep5)

programme.title: Rainbow Butterfly Unicorn Kitty

programme.title: Rainbow Butterfly Unicorn Kitty
programme.desc: Tooth Or Consequences: Someone is stealing the gold coins the Saber Tooth Fairy exchanges for loose teeth. (S1 Ep32)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Gwen Scary, Gwen Lost - Part 2: Gwen's plan turns out far spookier than Chef ever hoped. (S3 Ep28)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Trousering Inferno: The Bad Guy Busters must reunite to save Izzy after Harold uncovers her previous identity and leads a super villain from her past right to her. (S3 Ep29)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: The Big Bangs Theory: Chef forgets the password for his computer, but knows it has something to do with one of the 99 previous explosions that took out the school. (S3 Ep30)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Mad Math: Taffy Road: After Courtney refuses to share her taffy winnings from a 'calculus for candy' competition, she's transported to a desolate future. (S3 Ep31)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Bearly Edible: After eating snacks meant for everyone and replacing them with disgusting low budget cookies from Barfvomita, Owen is full of guilt and tries to make things right. (S3 Ep32)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Not for the Paint of Heart: When Izzy believes that Chef wants her to "Rise to the Challenge" of destroying the daycare with art, she gets some magic paint to bring her creations to life. (S3 Ep33)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Daycare of Rock: After believing he's turned Chef to stone Duncan sets his sights on ultimate chaos only to discover there's no joy in victory without an adversary. (S3 Ep34)

programme.title: Total Dramarama

programme.desc: The Tree Stooges Save Christmas PT2: The kids accidentally destroy Chef's decorated Christmas tree. So they go on an epic mission to replace his holiday treasures. (S3 Ep36)

programme.title: Total Dramarama

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Cactus Makes Perfect: Cody's friends become concerned when he forms a new friendship with a cactus. (S3 Ep38)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Virtual Reality Bites: When the school switches to virtual reality, Harold uses the opportunity to get the respect he feels he rightfully deserves. (S3 Ep39)

programme.title: Mademoiselle
programme.desc: 1966. Drama. Directed by Tony Richardson. Stars Jeanne Moreau, Ettore Manni & Keith Skinner. A schoolteacher channels her repressed passion into secret acts of violence and destruction. [S]

programme.title: Resurrection of Zachary Wheeler
programme.desc: 1971. Sci-Fi starring Leslie Nielsen, Bradford Dillman and Don Haggerty. After a terrible car accident, a presidential candidate awakens in a New Mexico clinic without a trace of injury. [S]

programme.title: Look At Life Having a Baby
programme.desc: 1964. A remarkable look at the medical and social services available for both hospital and home births.

programme.title: Richard Diamond: Private Detective
programme.desc: The Mouse. 1960. Stars David Janssen, Russ Conway & Narda Onyx. Diamond is hired by a woman who is being threatened by a man she saw die 15 years earlier.

programme.title: Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: The Case of the Shy Ballerina. 1954. Starring: Ronald Howard, Howard Marion-Crawford & Archie Duncan. Dr. Watson comes home with another man's coat. The other man is murdered late that same night. [S]

programme.title: The Way Out
programme.desc: 1955. Crime. Director Montgomery Tully. Stars Gene Nelson, Mona Freeman & John Bentley. A man tells his wife he is being framed for murder, but the more she helps the more holes she finds. [S]

programme.title: Tons of Trouble
programme.desc: 1956. Comedy. Directed by Leslie S. Hiscott. Stars Richard Hearne & William Hartnell. Mr Pastry names the apartment boilers he maintains 'Mavis and Ethel'. Trouble begins when he faces the sack. [S]

programme.title: Love In Pawn
programme.desc: 1953. Comedy. Penniless couple Roger (Bernard Braden) and Jean (Barbara Kelly) will get £10,000 if Roger can live a sober and profitable life. Starring Reg Dixon and John Laurie. [S]

programme.title: Heavens Above!
programme.desc: 1963. Comedy. Directed by John & Roy Boulting. Stars Peter Sellers, Ian Carmichael, Cecil Parker & Eric Sykes. Due to mistaken identity, a minister is accidently appointed to a snobbish parish. [S]

programme.title: Cover Girl Killer
programme.desc: 1959. Crime. Someone is murdering cover girl models, leaving them in the same pose and place as featured in 'Wow' magazine. Stars: Harry H. Corbett, Felicity Young. [S]

programme.title: Crown Court
programme.desc: The Most Expensive Steak in the World - Part 1. 1973. Stars Ronald Radd & James Copeland. An Argentinian rancher is suing a Scottish beef farmer after he bought a bull which was impotent. [S]

programme.title: Crown Court
programme.desc: The Most Expensive Steak in the World - Part 2. 1973. Stars Milton Johns & Ronald Radd. Gus Enderby takes to the stand and tells how Angelos Da Costa conspired with him to rig the auction. [S]

programme.title: Crown Court
programme.desc: The Most Expensive Steak in the World - Part 3. 1973. Stars Duncan Lamont, Hal Galili & John Alkin. Veterinary surgeon Michael Shipton and American vet Frank Brady both give evidence. [S]

programme.title: A Tale Of Two Cities
programme.desc: 1958. Drama. Directed by Ralph Thomas. Stars Dirk Bogarde, Dorothy Tutin, Cecil Parker & Stephen Murray. During the French Revolution, Lucie Manette falls in love with a duplicitous Englishman. [S]

programme.title: Mr. Beamish Goes South
programme.desc: 1953. Mystery. Directed by Oscar Burn & John Wall. Stars John Laurie & Hector Ross. An amateur detective pursues a seaside serial killer who disposes of his female victims in an acid bath. [S]

programme.title: The Cheaters
programme.desc: The Authentic McCoy. 1961. Stars John Ireland, Bill Nagy, Neil Hallett. When penniless Henry McCoy dies, his lawyer discovers he was once rich and plans to get the cash before his son shows up. [S]

programme.title: The Brothers
programme.desc: Oranges and Lemons. 1976. Stars Colin Baker, Carole Mowlam & Jennifer Wilson. Merroney tests Jennifer upon her return to the firm. Bored with their marriage, Gwen issues Bill an ultimatum. [S]

programme.title: Travelling Man
programme.desc: The Watcher. 1984. Stars Leigh Lawson & Con O'Neill. Lomax's search for his son brings him to an isolated and unwelcoming Welsh village. Things get worse for him when a young girl goes missing. [S]

programme.title: The Gold Robbers
programme.desc: An Oddly Honest Man. 1969. Stars Peter Vaughan, Ian Hendry & Wanda Ventham. The pilot who flew the plane, appears to be prepared to spill the beans. But can Cradock really trust the man? [S]

programme.title: The Glass
programme.desc: Episode 4. 2001. Stars John Thaw, Sarah Lancashire & Paul Jesson. No more games. Duggan's secrets are out. Proctor confronts Duggan about his sabotage of the company. [S]

programme.title: Murder East, Murder West
programme.desc: 1990. Thriller. Directed by Peter Smith. Stars Jeroen Krabbé, Suzanna Hamilton & Joanna Pearce. A crook finds his past catching up with him in the shape of the ex-girlfriend he thought was dead.

programme.title: Murder East, Murder West
programme.desc: 1990. Thriller. Directed by Peter Smith. Stars Jeroen Krabbé, Suzanna Hamilton & Joanna Pearce. A crook finds his past catching up with him in the shape of the ex-girlfriend he thought was dead.

programme.title: The Cat Burglar
programme.desc: 1961. Crime Drama. Directed by William Whitney. Stars Jack Hogan, June Kenney & John Baer. A burglar becomes a valuable target after stealing a briefcase that contains a secret formula. [S]

programme.title: Fighting Man of the Plains
programme.desc: 1949. Western. Stars Randolph Scott, Bill Williams & Victor Jory. Jim Dancer, one of Quantrill's Raiders, stages attacks on Kansas on behalf of the fallen Confederacy. [S]

programme.title: Zane Grey: Thread of Respect
programme.desc: 1959. Western. Directed by John English. Stars Danny Thomas, Nick Adams & James Coburn. An immigrant and his son are met with hostility when they open a tailor shop in a new town.

programme.title: Web of Evidence
programme.desc: 1959. Thriller. Director: Jack Cardiff. Stars Van Johnson, Vera Miles, Bernard Lee & Jean Kent. A WW2 evacuee returns years later to England and finds his father in prison and framed for murder. [S]

programme.title: Meet Mr Callaghan
programme.desc: 1954. Crime drama directed by Charles Saunders. Private detective Slim Callaghan (Derrick De Marney) is hired to find out why a rich uncle changed his will. [S]

programme.title: Three Steps to the Gallows
programme.desc: 1953. Drama. Director John Gilling. American cargo ship Officer Stevens (Scott Brady), finds out that his brother is the frame-up victim of a smuggling gang and is due to be executed for murder. [S]

programme.title: The Mysterious Mr Nicholson
programme.desc: 1947. Crime drama. Directed by Oswald Mitchell and starring Anthony Hulme, Lesley Osmond and Frank Hawkins. A solicitors' clerk is sent to deliver a will and finds the recipient murdered. [S]

programme.title: River Patrol
programme.desc: 1948. Crime Drama. Director: Ben R. Hart. Stars John Blythe, Wally Patch & Stan Paskin. Two police officers go undercover as husband and wife to expose a smuggling ring operating along the Thames. [S]

programme.title: The Ship That Died of Shame
programme.desc: (AKA PT Raiders) 1955. Thriller. Director Basil Dearden. Stars Richard Attenborough, George Baker and Bill Owen. A trio of ex-servicemen begin smuggling black market items into post-war Britain. [S]

programme.title: White Corridors
programme.desc: 1951. Drama. Directed by Pat Jackson. Stars Googie Withers, James Donald & Petula Clark. An insightful story about the day to day activities within Yeoman's Hospital during the early 1950s. [S]

programme.title: The Writing on the Wall
programme.desc: Mike Read embarks on an intriguing journey exploring the Blue Plaques across Britain, bringing to life the numerous people who have contributed something unique to the making of our country. [S]

programme.title: The Brave Don't Cry
programme.desc: 1952. Drama. Directed by Philip Leacock. Starring John Gregson, Meg Buchanan & John Rae. Based on a true story. In a small Scots mining-town, a mine cave-in seals the entire crew. [S]

programme.title: Strange But True
programme.desc: Dowsing/Near Death Experience. 1995. Michael Aspel introduces extraordinary stories including a man whose predictions started to come true and a woman who was brought back from the brink of death. [S]

programme.title: Cellar Club with Caroline Munro
programme.desc: Join Caroline Munro for an evening of investigations and a bit of horror. The first offering of the evening is the 70s series Doomwatch and the captivating episode By the Pricking of My Thumbs. [S]

programme.title: Doomwatch
programme.desc: By the Pricking of My Thumbs. 1971. Stars John Nolan, Jean Trend, Sally Thomsett & Colin Jeavons. A schoolboy is expelled because of his genes. Can people be labelled for life by science? [S]

programme.title: Cellar Club with Caroline Munro
programme.desc: Next up, we remain in the 70s with a spine tingling feature! Caroline Munro introduces the 1978 sci-fi horror The Alpha Incident, about a deadly alien organism that threatens to end humanity. [S]

programme.title: The Alpha Incident
programme.desc: 1978. Sci-fi. Directed by Bill Rebane. Stars Ralph Meeker, Stafford Morgan & John F. Goff. An alien organism with the potential to destroy all life on Earth is accidently released in a small town. [S]

programme.title: Cellar Club with Caroline Munro
programme.desc: Caroline Munro leaves the doors open for a little bit longer to give a peek at next week's unforgettable features. [S]

programme.title: Hot Money
programme.desc: 2001. Crime Drama. Directed by Terry Winsor. Stars Caroline Quentin, Melanie Hill & Georgia Mackenzie. Three women plot to steal thousands of pounds from the Bank of England's incinerators. [S]
